summaries.brief_summary: Discussion activity on WASM stack switching and number type conversion issues
summaries.activity_summary: Ongoing discussion on WASM effects implementation and Binaryen dependency updates
summaries.activity:
- **WASM stack switching** development continued with [Linxuan M](https://github.com/linxuanm) from the Wizard engine team asking about Binaryen dependency management and [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) clarifying that the outdated `binaryen-bin` dependency issue was resolved in [#2134](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/2134) ([#1832](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/1832))
- **Number type conversion** issue discussed by [@tari3x](https://github.com/tari3x) regarding migration challenges introduced by changes from [#1650](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/1650), seeking advice on upgrading code that no longer compiles ([#2136](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2136))
summaries.trends_summary: Active development on WASM runtime capabilities with focus on standards compliance
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **WASM runtime maturation** continues with ongoing work on stack switching proposal implementation ([#1832](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/1832)) and WASI runtime support ([#1831](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/1831)), both draft PRs by [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon)
- **Breaking changes management** surfacing as users encounter migration challenges from recent number type changes, highlighting need for better upgrade documentation or compatibility options ([#2136](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2136))
- **Cross-project collaboration** between js_of_ocaml and Wizard engine team working on stack switching benchmarks, with dependency management being streamlined ([#1832](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/1832))
summaries.contributors_summary: Activity from Jérôme Vouillon, Linxuan M, and tari3x on WASM features and migration issues
summaries.contributors:
- [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) provided technical support on Binaryen dependency management and rebased the stack switching PR to incorporate recent fixes ([#1832](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/1832))
- [Linxuan M](https://github.com/linxuanm) engaged from the Wizard engine team seeking clarification on building wasm_of_ocaml for benchmarking stack switching implementation ([#1832](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/1832))
- [@tari3x](https://github.com/tari3x) reported challenges with number type conversion changes and sought migration guidance ([#2136](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2136))

summaries.brief_summary: Dependency management improvements with Binaryen documentation updates and issue discussions on compatibility and licensing
summaries.new_features_summary: Updated Binaryen dependency documentation requiring version 119 or later for wasm_of_ocaml
summaries.new_features:
- **Binaryen dependency** switched from `binaryen-bin` to `conf-binaryen` opam package, allowing use of distribution-provided Binaryen tools ([#2134](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2134))
- **Documentation updates** clarifying Binaryen version 119 or later requirement for `wasm_of_ocaml-compiler` in README and manual ([b329014](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/b329014705f1e347edaf01c0a9202d5a747e971c))
- **CI workflow cleanup** removing redundant Binaryen installation from GitHub Actions workflows ([b329014](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/b329014705f1e347edaf01c0a9202d5a747e971c))
summaries.activity_summary: Merged Binaryen dependency improvements and ongoing discussions on stack overflow issues, WASI runtime, and API migration challenges
summaries.activity:
- **Binaryen dependency management** improved by [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) through merging [#2134](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2134), which switched to `conf-binaryen` package enabling use of distribution-provided Binaryen tools instead of building from source, addressing [#2131](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2131) by [@shym](https://github.com/shym)
- **WASI runtime** development continues with [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) discussing merge timeline for [#1831](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1831), while [#2108](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2108) remains open for JavaScript eval function access in Wasm runtime
- **Draft benchmark PR** [#2099](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2099) reviewed by [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) questioning whether still needed, with 17K additions and 24K deletions affecting 326 files
- **Opam repository archival PR** [#2138](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2138) closed without merging after being opened by [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo)
summaries.discussions_summary: Active troubleshooting of stack overflow issues and discussions on number type migration challenges
summaries.notable_discussions:
- **Stack overflow bug** investigation in [#2122](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2122) by [Nikos Nikoleris](https://github.com/relokin) affecting Chrome and other browsers when parsing AArch64 code with Menhir-generated parsers, traced to commit 29c693b with [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) suggesting potential larger stack frames from new compilation scheme
- **Number type migration** guidance provided in [#2136](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2136) where [@tari3x](https://github.com/tari3x) seeks advice on updating code broken by [#1650](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1650), with [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) recommending manual conversion insertions or temporary patching of `js.mli` and `js.ml` files
- **License exception text** clarification requested in [#2137](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2137) by [Jessica Marz](https://github.com/jkmarz) identifying potential typo matching original OCaml project's error, with additional observation about version mismatch between documentation and actual LGPL license text
summaries.trends_summary: Focus on toolchain compatibility improvements and addressing compilation scheme side effects
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Distribution integration** improvements through conf-packages enabling better system integration and reducing build-from-source requirements, as evidenced by [#2134](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2134) and [#2131](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2131)
- **Compilation scheme side effects** surfacing as runtime issues, particularly stack overflow problems in [#2122](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2122) requiring investigation of stack frame size impacts from new compilation approaches
- **API evolution challenges** highlighted in [#2136](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2136) showing tension between WASM-driven improvements and maintenance burden for non-WASM users
summaries.contributors_summary: Hugo Heuzard merged dependency improvements while Jérôme Vouillon provided technical guidance on multiple issues
summaries.contributors:
- [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) merged [#2134](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2134) switching Binaryen dependency to conf-package, closed [#2138](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2138) opam archival PR, and reviewed [#2099](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2099) benchmark PR
- [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) provided technical guidance on stack overflow investigation in [#2122](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2122), migration advice in [#2136](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2136), and discussed WASI runtime merge timeline in [#1831](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1831)
- [@shym](https://github.com/shym) opened [#2131](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2131) requesting distribution-provided Binaryen support with detailed rationale
- [Nikos Nikoleris](https://github.com/relokin) reported and investigated stack overflow bug in [#2122](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2122) affecting herdtools7 browser interface
- [@tari3x](https://github.com/tari3x) opened [#2136](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2136) seeking migration guidance for number type changes
- [Jessica Marz](https://github.com/jkmarz) identified license exception text issues in [#2137](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2137) with supporting documentation references

summaries.brief_summary: Runtime improvements and documentation cleanup with new API for accessing JavaScript runtime values
summaries.new_features_summary: New runtime_value API for accessing JavaScript runtime values directly
summaries.new_features:
- New `Jsoo_runtime.Js.runtime_value` function enables direct access to JavaScript values exported in the runtime, addressing integration needs for libraries like gen_js_api ([#2086](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/2086))
- Runtime **filesystem implementation** fixes for fake filesystem with regex special characters in paths, preventing issues when paths contain characters like brackets or periods ([#2132](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/2132))
- Improved **file object handling** in runtime with position tracking and proper return values for file operations ([d20d794](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/d20d794d743159eeddd677edf1ddd0d4fc7b1821), [0632eb9](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/0632eb9daab50052c44c0754bdda8a7be8dceabe))
- Enhanced **runtime portability** with platform detection helpers like `jsoo_is_win32` for better cross-platform compatibility ([1a7be1c](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/1a7be1cfb0dee9c7668bfcaa6613de486a5aff43))
- Fixed **file truncation** behavior to handle length correctly when truncating to sizes larger than current file ([45f8033](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/45f80c336ffe06729b8584bd211dc3491c625c5b))
- Corrected **directory operations** in fake filesystem replacing regex-based matching with more reliable string prefix checks ([d20d794](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/d20d794d743159eeddd677edf1ddd0d4fc7b1821))
- Documentation improvements across manual pages correcting typos like "JavasScript" to "JavaScript" and "strace" to "stack trace" ([f5dfc0a](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/f5dfc0aff4ab158f89efdfee7ec91d1c8a2be598), [e0d055a](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/e0d055a085b0a137c52d60d0f6f778ce9dcea76b))
summaries.activity_summary: Runtime improvements for Deno support and binaryen dependency work ongoing
summaries.activity:
- [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) opened PR for **binaryen dependency** management to address missing dependency issues with documentation needed for version constraints ([#2134](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/2134), fixing [#2131](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2131))
- [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) has **Wasm runtime** work in progress providing JavaScript eval function access for Wasm runtime with merge conflicts to resolve ([#2108](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/2108))
- [@toastal](https://github.com/toastal) continues work on **Intl.RelativeTimeFormat** API bindings for ECMAScript internationalization support ([#2070](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/2070))
- [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) merged **runtime improvements** preparing infrastructure for Deno support with cleanup and various runtime fixes ([#2132](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/2132))
- [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) merged **runtime value access** feature enabling direct access to JavaScript runtime exports for better integration with JavaScript code ([#2086](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/2086))
- [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) merged **documentation fixes** correcting typos across 43 files in manual and codebase ([#2133](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/2133))
- Draft PR for **shapes with Dune support** was closed without merging ([#2047](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/2047))
summaries.discussions_summary: User seeking guidance on migrating code affected by number type changes
summaries.notable_discussions: - [@tari3x](https://github.com/tari3x) opened discussion about **number type migration** challenges following breaking changes from previous work, asking for conversion strategies and whether old behavior could be maintained for non-Wasm users ([#2136](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2136), referencing [#1650](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/1650))
summaries.trends_summary: Focus on runtime portability and preparing infrastructure for new JavaScript environments
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Runtime portability** emerging as theme with platform detection helpers, filesystem abstraction improvements, and Deno preparation work indicating expansion beyond Node.js and browser environments ([#2132](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/2132))
- **JavaScript interoperability** enhancements through new runtime value access API and Wasm eval function support showing continued investment in seamless integration between OCaml and JavaScript code ([#2086](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/2086), [#2108](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/2108))
- **Code quality** emphasis with extensive documentation cleanup affecting 43 files and correcting historical typos throughout the manual and codebase ([#2133](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/2133))
summaries.contributors_summary: [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) drove all merged work this week with runtime improvements and API additions
summaries.contributors:
- [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) merged three PRs this week including runtime value access API ([#2086](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/2086)), runtime improvements for Deno support ([#2132](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/2132)), and documentation cleanup across 43 files ([#2133](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/2133)), plus opened new PR for binaryen dependency management ([#2134](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/2134)) and closed draft shapes PR ([#2047](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/2047))
- [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) received ping on pending Wasm runtime eval function PR which has merge conflicts ([#2108](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/2108))
- [@tari3x](https://github.com/tari3x) opened issue seeking migration advice for code broken by number type changes ([#2136](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2136))
- [@toastal](https://github.com/toastal) maintains pending PR for Intl.RelativeTimeFormat bindings ([#2070](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/2070))

summaries.brief_summary: Runtime improvements for Deno support and a feature request for distribution-provided Binaryen
summaries.activity_summary: Runtime improvements opened for Deno support and CI workflow dependency update merged

summaries.brief_summary: Browser target bug fix merged, ongoing WebAssembly development continues
summaries.new_features_summary: Runtime now properly handles browser target without requiring Node.js modules
summaries.new_features:
- Fixed **runtime behavior** for `target-env=browser` to eliminate erroneous `require("node:util")` and similar Node.js imports in browser-targeted builds, with new browser-specific implementations for `caml_sys_temp_dir_name` and `caml_strerror` functions ([#2129](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2129))
- Added **test coverage** to verify browser-targeted builds no longer include Node.js-specific require calls ([46958641d0a8e98c6ee86cf1e767236a51a3d61c](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/46958641d0a8e98c6ee86cf1e767236a51a3d61c))
summaries.activity_summary: WebAssembly eval function and benchmark PRs remain in development
summaries.activity:
- [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon)'s **WebAssembly runtime** PR providing access to JavaScript eval function continues in review with pending comments from [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) before merge ([#2108](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2108))
- **Performance benchmarking** work comparing Js_of_ocaml and Wasm_of_ocaml remains in draft status with merge conflicts affecting 326 files ([#2099](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2099))
summaries.discussions_summary: WebAssembly export capabilities and runtime compatibility being explored
summaries.notable_discussions:
- [NSlash951](https://github.com/myfreess) inquired about **exporting specific OCaml functions** in WebAssembly output from wasm_of_ocaml, with [@ec-c](https://github.com/ec-c) expressing interest in this currently unsupported feature ([#2028](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2028))
- [@nickbetteridge](https://github.com/nickbetteridge) reported switching from **wamr to wasmtime** runtime due to type mismatch issues, noting they're waiting for the WASI runtime PR ([#1831](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1831)) to be merged before releasing their wit library work ([#1929](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1929))
summaries.contributors_summary: Two contributors active with bug fix implementation and ongoing PR reviews
summaries.contributors:
- [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) fixed the browser target runtime issue by implementing browser-specific versions of system functions, added comprehensive test coverage to detect Node.js require calls in browser builds, and provided review feedback on the WebAssembly eval function PR ([#2129](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2129), [#2108](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2108))
- [Rizo](https://github.com/rizo) reported the browser target bug that was preventing upgrades to the latest version and confirmed the fix resolved their issue ([#2127](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2127))
- [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) continues work on the WebAssembly runtime eval function PR awaiting final review comments ([#2108](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2108))
- [NSlash951](https://github.com/myfreess) and [@ec-c](https://github.com/ec-c) participated in discussion about WebAssembly function export capabilities ([#2028](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2028))
- [@nickbetteridge](https://github.com/nickbetteridge) provided updates on WebAssembly runtime compatibility challenges and workarounds ([#1929](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1929))

summaries.brief_summary: PPX bug fixes for unused self warnings and labelled arguments in object methods merged this week
summaries.new_features_summary: Fixed spurious unused variable warnings for self in object%js and restored labelled arguments for methods
summaries.new_features:
- Fixed spurious unused variable warning for `self` in `object%js` when methods don't use the self reference by marking it as used internally ([#2128](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2128), [a545a47](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/a545a47e877dc6c4b526f6e332c6818e13408785))
- Restored **labelled arguments** support for methods in class types by fixing PPX code generation that was broken in 6.2.0 ([#2126](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2126), [b8b2146](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/b8b21466e9a4f40a2a99e5864ef3d52b08a9efc2), [02d2403](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/02d2403b5481778fa9eabe621d90892f6f7d1108))
- Improved `ppx_optcomp_light` with **conditional module inclusion** in signatures and more robust pattern matching ([0bd02fe](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/0bd02fe081dc8e1a2a6a082c35ea1a5fe541de52), [593f9bd](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/593f9bda6470621caa318452786752895b5c6d39), [77f3f78](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/77f3f7898cd479232dc4253dc4e158debd4b38c2))
summaries.activity_summary: Development focused on effects implementation, WASI runtime, and Oxcaml support alongside PPX maintenance work
summaries.activity:
- [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) merged PPX fix for unused self variable warnings in `object%js` ([#2128](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2128))
- [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) merged `ppx_optcomp_light` improvements for conditional module inclusion and attribute handling ([#2117](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2117)) and PPX cleanup work ([#2120](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2120))
- Draft PR for **effects implementation** based on Stack Switching proposal continues development, targeting Wasm code generation with Binaryen and Wizard engine support ([#1832](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1832))
- **WASI runtime** PR remains open with support for producing WASI binaries using `--enable wasi` flag, executable with both Wizard engine and wasmtime ([#1831](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1831))
- Draft PR for **Oxcaml support** continues with over 10,000 lines of additions across 147 files ([#2105](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2105))
- [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) opened draft PR for **string conversion and arraybuffer optimizations** targeting Wasm improvements ([#2124](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2124))
- PR proposing direct access to runtime-exported values to address gen_js_api requirements remains under review ([#2086](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2086))
summaries.discussions_summary: Bug reports for node:util references in browser builds and stack overflow with menhir parsers remain under investigation
summaries.notable_discussions:
- [John Jackson](https://github.com/johnridesabike) reported unused variable warning for `self` in `object%js` when methods don't reference it, leading to quick fix by [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) ([#2125](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2125))
- [@tari3x](https://github.com/tari3x) reported **labelled arguments** stopped working after upgrading to 6.2.0, with [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) confirming the issue was resolved by [#2120](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2120) which had already merged ([#2126](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2126))
- [Rizo](https://github.com/rizo) reported generated code includes `node:util` references even with `--target-env browser` flag in dev profile, with [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) requesting [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) investigate as it relates to [#1823](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1823) ([#2127](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2127))
- [Nikos Nikoleris](https://github.com/relokin) continues debugging **stack overflow** issue affecting AArch64 parser in herdtools7 when using menhir-generated parsers in Chrome, with issue traced back to commit 29c693b ([#2122](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2122))
summaries.trends_summary: Focus on PPX reliability and Wasm capabilities with effects and WASI runtime development
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **PPX maintenance** addressing edge cases and compiler compatibility issues demonstrates focus on code generation reliability across OCaml versions
- **Wasm development** progressing on multiple fronts with effects implementation ([#1832](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1832)), WASI runtime ([#1831](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1831)), and performance optimizations ([#2124](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2124))
- **Browser compatibility** issues surfacing with node-specific code appearing in browser builds and stack overflow problems in certain browsers ([#2127](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2127), [#2122](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2122))
summaries.contributors_summary: Jérôme Vouillon and hhugo handled PPX improvements while community members reported and helped debug issues
summaries.contributors:
- [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) merged PPX improvements for `ppx_optcomp_light` ([#2117](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2117)) and `ppx_js` cleanup ([#2120](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2120)), opened draft PR for Wasm string and arraybuffer optimizations ([#2124](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2124)), and continues work on effects implementation ([#1832](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1832)), WASI runtime ([#1831](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1831)), and Oxcaml support ([#2105](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2105))
- [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) fixed unused self warning in `object%js` ([#2128](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2128)), triaged bug reports, and reviewed PPX changes ([#2117](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2117))
- [John Jackson](https://github.com/johnridesabike) reported unused variable warning issue with clear reproduction case ([#2125](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2125))

summaries.brief_summary: Tools exit code handling fixed, test suite concurrency improved, and code formatting updated
summaries.new_features_summary: Fixed exit code handling in jsoo_minify and wasmoo_link_wasm tools
summaries.new_features:
- Fixed **exit code handling** in `jsoo_minify` and `wasmoo_link_wasm` command-line tools to properly propagate error codes instead of calling `exit` directly within exception handlers ([#2121](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2121), [9227923](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/9227923fa863adefbfb5821dd6c2823c3587eea1))
- Fixed **test suite concurrency issue** in lib-unix/common tests by adding file lock and cleanup to prevent race conditions when tests run in parallel ([#2123](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2123), [f89ccef](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/f89ccef0a89461d7d19eea8f1627df4fcb043398))
- Updated **ocamlformat** from version 0.27.0 to 0.28.1 with reformatting across 36 files in the codebase ([#2119](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2119), [ef4983f](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/ef4983f68c87976365cafbef8f62b15dbcc9eec1))

summaries.activity_summary: Three new PRs opened exploring ppx improvements, cmdliner v2, and ocamlformat updates

summaries.discussions_summary: Technical discussions on cmdliner compatibility and ppx implementation strategies
summaries.notable_discussions:

- **ppx_optcomp_light improvements** received architectural feedback from [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) suggesting matching on signatures instead of individual items for consistency with structure handling ([#2117](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2117))
- **Wasm runtime export feature** discussion between [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) and [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) explored mechanisms for re-exporting JavaScript values, with proposals for annotations in runtime files or import namespace tricks ([#2086](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2086))

summaries.brief_summary: Bug fixes for compiler inlining and improved NaN handling in both JavaScript and WebAssembly runtimes
summaries.new_features_summary: Improved NaN handling ensures consistent behavior across V8 and other JavaScript engines
summaries.new_features:
- **Consistent NaN handling** across JavaScript engines by converting signaling NaNs to quiet NaNs in `caml_int64_bits_of_float` and `caml_int64_float_of_bits` functions, addressing V8's use of signaling NaNs as sentinels ([#2110](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2110))
- Fixed **compiler inlining bug** that caused assertion failures with `Some variables escaped` error in release mode builds ([#2107](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2107))
- **WebAssembly backend cleanup** reducing code complexity with 976 insertions and 887 deletions across the generate.ml module ([#2109](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2109))
- **Magic number version** now obtained from compiler-libs instead of hardcoded values ([c2426e77](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/c2426e77d2650146a1cefcb4e2cc81ea0238f5d2))
- **Bigarray runtime fix** in WebAssembly preventing tail calls to well-known JavaScript primitives to ensure proper inlining ([b896922d](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/b896922d824e8680d04f5da3b2d8741cd366648c))
summaries.activity_summary: Active development on WebAssembly runtime features and OCaml 5.4 compatibility testing
summaries.activity:
- **New PR opened** for JavaScript eval function access in WebAssembly runtime by [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon), with discussion about ensuring consistent behavior between JS and Wasm backends and handling of extra parentheses for invalid inputs ([#2108](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2108))
- **OCaml 5.4 CI testing** work ongoing by [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo), currently blocked on wasm_of_ocaml compatibility and requiring ppx_expect.v0.17.3 with ppxlib.0.37 support ([#2103](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2103))
- **Oxcaml support** draft PR continues development with 11,208 additions across 141 files by [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) ([#2105](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2105))
- **WASI runtime** PR remains in progress with 4,835 additions supporting Wizard engine and wasmtime execution with stack-switching and exception handling extensions ([#1831](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1831))
- **Compiler hints** from [ocaml/ocaml#13438](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13438) being integrated in draft PR by [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo), though currently in conflicting state ([#1721](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1721))
summaries.discussions_summary: Discussion about WebAssembly runtime consistency with JavaScript backend for eval functionality
summaries.notable_discussions:
- **Eval function behavior** discussed between [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) and [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) regarding extra parentheses in WebAssembly runtime versus JavaScript runtime, with concerns about accepting invalid inputs like `"a)(b"` and trade-offs documented in code comments ([#2108](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2108))
- **Testing requirements** emphasized by [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) for WebAssembly eval function to ensure agreement between Wasm and JS runtimes and verify that inlining optimization doesn't change behavior ([#2108](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2108))
summaries.trends_summary: Continued focus on WebAssembly backend improvements and runtime consistency
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **WebAssembly runtime maturity** demonstrated through cleanup work, bigarray fixes, and ongoing WASI runtime development showing commitment to Wasm as first-class compilation target ([#2109](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2109), [#2112](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2112), [#1831](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1831))
- **Cross-backend consistency** emphasized in discussions about eval function and NaN handling, ensuring identical behavior between JavaScript and WebAssembly runtimes ([#2108](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2108), [#2110](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2110))
- **OCaml compiler evolution** tracking shown through compiler-libs integration, OCaml 5.4 testing, and consuming hints from upstream OCaml compiler improvements ([#2111](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2111), [#2103](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2103), [#1721](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1721))
summaries.contributors_summary: Jérôme Vouillon and Hugo Heuzard actively developing features with Nicolás Ojeda Bär providing bug reports and testing
summaries.contributors:

- [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) fixed compiler inlining bug ([#2107](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2107)), provided code review feedback on NaN handling and eval function PRs ([#2110](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2110), [#2108](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2108)), and continues work on OCaml 5.4 CI integration ([#2103](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2103))
- [Nicolás Ojeda Bär](https://github.com/nojb) reported compiler inlining bug with detailed reproduction information and debug output ([#2106](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2106)) and confirmed the fix resolved the issue ([#2107](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2107))

summaries.brief_summary: Windows CRLF handling improvements and bug investigation for variable escaping issue
summaries.new_features_summary: Improved Windows line ending support by removing CRLF workarounds and adding binary mode handling
summaries.new_features:

- Added **binary mode output** to `gen_dune.ml` test generator to ensure consistent line ending handling across platforms ([eaea1a1](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/eaea1a102f339911f9bf867a5d0b9f1ce53f1ec4))
- Enhanced **JavaScript parser** to handle `\r` (carriage return) as whitespace in token processing ([eaea1a1](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/eaea1a102f339911f9bf867a5d0b9f1ce53f1ec4))
- Updated **multiline string tests** to normalize CRLF to LF for consistent parsing validation ([eaea1a1](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/eaea1a102f339911f9bf867a5d0b9f1ce53f1ec4))
summaries.activity_summary: Bug investigation for variable escaping in release builds and ongoing OCaml 5.4 support work
summaries.activity:
- [Nicolás Ojeda Bär](https://github.com/nojb) **opened bug report** for variable escaping assertion failure in release builds with `--linkall` flag, traced to tail-modulo-cons and closure duplication issues potentially related to previous closure optimization work ([#2106](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2106))
- [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) **investigating** the variable escaping bug with suspicion that live variable tracking is not properly updated when duplicating closures, requesting review from [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) ([#2106](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2106))
- [@toastal](https://github.com/toastal) **opened PR** to add `Intl.RelativeTimeFormat` JavaScript API bindings for internationalized relative time formatting, awaiting review ([#2070](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/2070))
- [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) **continuing work** on OCaml 5.4 support testing in draft PR ([#2103](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/2103))
- [Rizo](https://github.com/rizo) **reported** issue with Node.js module references appearing in browser-targeted builds when using dev profile, which doesn't occur with release profile ([#1809](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1809))

- **Build system modernization** through elimination of platform-specific git configuration hacks in CI workflows ([#2087](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/2087))
- **Compiler optimization bugs** surfacing with complex feature interactions like tail-modulo-cons, closure duplication, and linkall flags requiring careful investigation ([#2106](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2106))

summaries.contributors:

summaries.brief_summary: Major 6.1.0 release with compiler performance improvements and bug fixes plus three new PRs opened
summaries.new_features_summary: Performance optimization for JavaScript code generation eliminating quadratic behavior in expression queue
summaries.new_features:
- **JavaScript code generation performance** significantly improved by eliminating quadratic behavior in expression queue, delivering 60% speedup for fiat-crypto, 14% for ocamlc, and 47% for partial-render-table ([#2066](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2066))
- **Version 6.1.0 release** published with comprehensive feature set including number unboxing, switch optimizations, tailcall improvements, deadcode elimination, and WASM enhancements ([release](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/releases/tag/6.1.0))
- **JavaScript reserved keywords list** updated to remove obsolete ECMAScript 3 keywords and fix duplicate `this` entry ([#2071](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2071))
summaries.activity_summary: Three new PRs opened including Intl.RelativeTimeFormat API addition and advanced number unboxing for WASM

- **Release preparation** completed by [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) with version bumps and configuration updates leading to 6.1.0 publication ([#2065](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2065))
- **Compiler architecture** refactored with helper functions moved to toplevel and removal of menhir library dependency for improved build process ([cd7dd7a](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/cd7dd7abd11e5d1ad9cf583fddfd045570671fa1), [a734547](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/a73454701e0bad32383fa03f671bc2f9f201a03b))

summaries.brief_summary: Major arity propagation system merged, warning controls enhanced, wasm optimizations delivered, and JS string support progressing
summaries.new_features_summary: Shape-based arity propagation, improved warning control system, and new `--load-shape` command-line flag
summaries.new_features:
- **Arity propagation between compilation units** using new shape system enables cross-module function optimization ([#1594](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1594))
- **Enhanced warning control system** with better granularity for jsoo warnings fixes previous warning management issues ([#2052](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2052))
- **New `--load-shape` command-line flag** for both js_of_ocaml and wasm_of_ocaml compilers enables explicit shape file loading for optimization
- **Optimized calls to statically known functions** in wasm backend improves performance ([#2044](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2044))
- **Fixed method lookup cache** with separate compilation addresses incorrect cache slot usage ([#2039](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2039))
- **Enhanced global dead code elimination** with improved IsInt test handling ([#2046](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2046))
- **Fixed WAT debug output** for wasm backend resolving partial application helper duplication ([#2050](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2050), [#2053](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2053))
summaries.activity_summary: Two new PRs opened for Shapes with dune support and biome fixes, while core infrastructure improvements were merged

- **Long-running feature development** continues with JavaScript string implementation by [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) ([#1772](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1772)), comprehensive function optimizations ([#2054](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2054)), and popover API support by [Sylvain Boilard](https://github.com/SylvainBoilard) ([#1734](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1734))

summaries.contributors_summary: Active collaboration between [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) and [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) on compiler optimization features
summaries.contributors:
- [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) implemented warning control system ([#2052](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2052)), method lookup cache fixes ([#2039](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2039)), CI improvements ([#2051](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2051), [#2049](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2049)), Jane Street test updates ([#2048](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2048)), and opened Shapes with dune support PR ([#2047](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2047))
- [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) delivered wasm optimizations ([#2044](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2044)), global dead code improvements ([#2046](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2046)), and WAT debug output fixes ([#2050](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2050), [#2053](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2053)), while continuing JavaScript string implementation ([#1772](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1772))
- [Sylvain Boilard](https://github.com/SylvainBoilard) received extensive review feedback on popover API implementation ([#1734](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1734)) with suggestions for property naming corrections and demo additions
- [Mesmera (WAFT)](https://github.com/mesmerizingwaft) addressed CSS Font Loading API review feedback ([#1833](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1833)) with discussions about promise return types and optional descriptors
- [Olivier Nicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole) provided benchmark performance analysis and timing feedback on JavaScript string implementation ([#1772](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1772))

summaries.brief_summary: Major WebAssembly optimizations and new browser API support with `window.matchMedia` functionality
summaries.new_features_summary: Added `window.matchMedia` API support and WebAssembly integer optimizations with type analysis improvements
summaries.new_features:
- **DOM API enhancement** with [@toastal](https://github.com/toastal) adding `window.matchMedia` and `MediaQueryList` support for responsive design in web applications ([#2017](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2017))
- **WebAssembly integer optimizations** by [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) to avoid `ref.i31/i31.get_s` operations that are poorly optimized by binaryen and V8 ([#2032](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2032))
- **JavaScript strict equality optimization** by [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) using type analysis to remove unnecessary JavaScript strict equality operations, reducing usage from 748 to 190 instances ([#2040](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2040))
- **WebAssembly type precision** improvements by [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) using more precise types in function environments, reducing cast operations from 37,949 to 35,553 ([#2041](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2041))
- **Function call optimization** for WebAssembly by [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) enabling direct calls to statically known functions instead of loading code pointers ([#2044](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2044))
- **Runtime text conversion** enhancement by [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) using TextEncoder/TextDecoder for UTF8-UTF16 conversions ([#1645](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1645))
- **PPX compatibility** improvement by [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) enabling tests to run with ppxlib 0.36 ([#2043](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2043))
summaries.activity_summary: WebAssembly compiler optimization focus with method lookup fixes and build infrastructure improvements
summaries.activity:
- **WebAssembly method lookup** fixes by [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) addressing separate compilation cache issues and eliminating GETDYNMET cache usage ([#2038](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2038), [#2039](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2039))
- **Build and testing infrastructure** improvements by [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) including CI fixes for ppx_css compatibility with sedlex ([#2037](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2037)) and disabling WebAssembly baseline compiler in microbenchmarks for optimized code performance ([#2036](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2036))
- **Global dead code optimization** enhancement by [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) ensuring IsInt tests retain only blocks, not their contents ([#2046](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2046))
- **Arity propagation** merged by [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) enabling function arity computation across compilation units with shape information stored in generated JavaScript ([#1594](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1594))
- **Ongoing performance work** includes [Olivier Nicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole)'s aggressive lambda lifting experiments ([#1886](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1886)) and WebAssembly JavaScript string implementation by [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) ([#1772](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1772))
summaries.trends_summary: WebAssembly backend receiving substantial optimization focus with type analysis and performance improvements
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **WebAssembly optimization priority** with multiple performance-focused PRs including integer optimizations, type analysis improvements, and function call optimization showing concentrated effort on WebAssembly backend performance
- **Browser API modernization** with addition of responsive design capabilities through `window.matchMedia` support, indicating focus on modern web standards
- **Compiler infrastructure refinement** through arity propagation and global flow analysis improvements, suggesting maturation of cross-compilation unit optimization capabilities
- **Testing and compatibility** improvements with ppxlib 0.36 support and CI infrastructure updates showing attention to developer experience and ecosystem compatibility
summaries.contributors_summary: Three core contributors drove WebAssembly optimizations, browser API additions, and infrastructure improvements
summaries.contributors:
- [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) led **WebAssembly optimization** efforts with integer optimizations ([#2032](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2032)), type analysis for equality optimization ([#2040](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2040)), function environment precision ([#2041](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2041)), statically known function call optimization ([#2044](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2044)), method lookup fixes ([#2038](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2038)), dead code optimization ([#2046](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2046)), CI fixes ([#2037](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2037)), and microbenchmark improvements ([#2036](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2036))
- [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) contributed **build system and compatibility** improvements including ppxlib 0.36 test support ([#2043](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2043)), TextEncoder/TextDecoder runtime integration ([#1645](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1645)), arity propagation across compilation units ([#1594](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1594)), method lookup cache fixes ([#2039](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2039)), and issue management for WebAssembly testing infrastructure ([#2035](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2035)) and ppxlib compatibility ([#2042](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2042))
- [@toastal](https://github.com/toastal) delivered **browser API modernization** by implementing `window.matchMedia` and `MediaQueryList` support for responsive web design capabilities ([#2017](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2017)), resolving a long-standing feature request from [Armaël Guéneau](https://github.com/Armael) ([#608](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/608))

summaries.brief_summary: OCaml 5.4 support added, WASM performance improvements with DataView primitives, and new benchmarking framework
summaries.new_features_summary: OCaml 5.4 support, WASM DataView bigarray optimization, DOM matchMedia API, and imported string constants
summaries.new_features:
- **OCaml 5.4 compatibility** added with new runtime primitives for domains, arrays, atomic operations, and system functions ([#2030](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2030))
- **WASM bigarray performance** improved by switching to DataView primitives instead of typed arrays for better V8 optimization ([#1979](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1979))
- **DOM matchMedia API** support added with `window.matchMedia` and `MediaQueryList` bindings for responsive web applications ([#2017](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2017))
- **WASM integer optimizations** implemented to avoid inefficient `ref.i31/i31.get_s` operations ([#2032](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2032))
- **WASM string constants** optimization using imported string constants from JS String Builtins proposal ([#2022](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2022))
- **Method lookup fix** in WASM runtime resolving class method resolution issues ([#2034](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2034))
- **Compiler inlining** improvements with increased laziness for better optimization convergence ([#2029](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2029))
- **Benchmarking infrastructure** expanded with new lexifi-g2pp, bin_prot, and bigarray benchmarks for performance testing
summaries.activity_summary: Major version preparation, WASM backend optimizations, and community API discussions active
summaries.activity:
- **OCaml 5.4 preparation** completed by [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) with comprehensive runtime primitive additions for the upcoming release ([#2030](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2030))
- **WASM performance focus** by [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) delivering multiple optimizations including DataView bigarrays ([#1979](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1979)), integer operations ([#2032](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2032)), and string constants ([#2022](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2022))
- **Arity propagation** between compilation units merged after extensive review, enabling cross-module function optimizations ([#1594](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1594))
- **Performance benchmarking** infrastructure extended with real-world test cases from lexifi-g2pp mathematical computations and bin_prot serialization ([#2025](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2025))
- **Compiler optimization** improvements including better inlining passes and more effective dead code elimination ([#2027](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2027), [#2029](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2029))
summaries.discussions_summary: Promise API integration and WASM export functionality discussed by community
summaries.notable_discussions:
- **Promise API integration** proposed by [Olivier Nicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole) suggesting inclusion of Funkywork's type-safe Promise bindings to unlock async/await patterns ([#2031](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2031))
- **WASM OCaml function exports** questioned by [NSlash951](https://github.com/myfreess) seeking best practices for exposing specific OCaml functions in WASM modules ([#2028](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2028))
summaries.trends_summary: WASM backend receiving focused performance optimization and OCaml 5.4 compatibility work
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **WASM performance priority** with multiple optimization PRs targeting V8 efficiency and runtime improvements
- **Modern JavaScript API support** expansion with Promise discussions and DOM API additions
- **Cross-compilation optimization** focus on better function arity propagation and inlining across module boundaries
- **Comprehensive benchmarking** approach using real-world mathematical and serialization workloads
summaries.contributors_summary: Two core maintainers driving OCaml 5.4 support and WASM optimizations with community API contributions
summaries.contributors:
- [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) led OCaml 5.4 compatibility work with runtime primitive additions ([#2030](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2030)), compiler optimizations ([#2029](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2029)), and performance improvements ([#2014](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2014))
- [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) focused on WASM backend optimization with DataView bigarray implementation ([#1979](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1979)), integer optimizations ([#2032](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2032)), string constants ([#2022](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2022)), and benchmarking framework ([#2025](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2025))
- [@toastal](https://github.com/toastal) contributed DOM API enhancements with matchMedia support for responsive web development ([#2017](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2017))
- [Olivier Nicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole) initiated Promise API integration discussion proposing type-safe async patterns ([#2031](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2031))
- [NSlash951](https://github.com/myfreess) raised WASM export functionality questions highlighting community needs ([#2028](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2028))

summaries.brief_summary: Compiler optimization improvements with enhanced inlining passes and effects handling plus Dom API additions
summaries.new_features_summary: Improved inlining optimization, effects double translation fixes, and DOM matchMedia API support
summaries.new_features:
- Enhanced **inlining optimization** ensuring inner closures are processed before enclosing closures, improving compilation performance ([3b5660d](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/3b5660d3d8b1ceaf230211ec04c3584a3931328e))
- Fixed **effects double translation** to avoid introducing unused blocks, preventing dead code generation ([68488a9](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/68488a984fd47bc329ddb4cfa3022a8f6c6fb972))
- Added **invariant checking** in continuous integration to catch compiler issues early ([5198a32](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/5198a32a91ddebe4ad4ec689fbabcc91b6fd70de))
- **Build system improvements** with conditional CI flags for debug invariant checking ([ea538fb](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/ea538fb69d7db4bb18ea60f90abfdebd4a030d15))
- Added **DOM matchMedia API** and MediaQueryList support in Dom_html module ([#2017](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2017))
summaries.activity_summary: Four new PRs opened while six optimization-focused PRs were merged addressing inlining and effects handling
summaries.activity:
- Four **new PRs opened** including experimental internal API changes by [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) ([#2019](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2019)), wasm string constant optimizations by [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) ([#2022](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2022)), benchmarking additions ([#2025](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2025)), and effects optimization improvements ([#2026](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2026), [#2027](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2027))
- **Compiler optimization** milestones achieved with inlining pass improvements by [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) ([#2018](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2018)), effects handling fixes ([#2021](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2021)), and invariant checking enhancements by [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) ([#2023](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2023), [#2024](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2024))
- **DOM API expansion** with [@toastal](https://github.com/toastal) contributing matchMedia and MediaQueryList support ([#2017](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2017)) addressing issue [#608](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/608)
- **Wasm backend development** progressing with string constant optimization and effects configuration improvements ([#2022](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2022), [#2026](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2026))
summaries.discussions_summary: Feature request discussion for recursive inlining optimization and Safari WebAssembly validation issue
summaries.notable_discussions:
- **Recursive inlining optimization** discussion initiated by [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) proposing single-pass recursive inlining for functions with interesting parameters ([#2020](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2020)), resolved by implementation in [#2027](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2027)
- **Safari WebAssembly compatibility** issue reported by [Ty Overby](https://github.com/TyOverby) with validation errors in Safari 18.4 ([#1975](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1975)), linked to WebKit bug resolution
summaries.trends_summary: Focus on compiler optimization efficiency with emphasis on inlining improvements and effects handling
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Compiler performance optimization** becoming primary focus with multiple PRs targeting inlining efficiency, dead code elimination, and optimization pass scheduling ([#2018](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2018), [#2021](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2021), [#2027](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2027))
- **Effects handling maturation** with continued refinements to double translation approach and new configuration options for disabling effects ([#2021](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2021), [#2026](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2026))
- **Testing and quality assurance** improvements with invariant checking integration and benchmark additions ([#2023](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2023), [#2025](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2025))
- **WebAssembly backend development** showing consistent progress with string handling optimizations and compatibility improvements ([#2022](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2022), [#1991](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1991))
summaries.contributors_summary: Three active contributors with Jérôme Vouillon leading optimization work and hhugo focusing on compiler internals
summaries.contributors:
- [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) implemented inlining optimization improvements ([#2018](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2018)), effects double translation fixes ([#2021](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2021)), wasm string constant optimizations ([#2022](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2022)), benchmark additions ([#2025](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2025)), effects configuration improvements ([#2026](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2026)), and more effective optimization passes ([#2027](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2027))
- [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) opened experimental internal API changes ([#2019](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2019)), contributed invariant checking improvements ([#2023](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2023)), performed code cleanup ([#2024](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2024)), initiated recursive inlining feature request ([#2020](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2020)), and provided extensive code review feedback on optimization changes
- [@toastal](https://github.com/toastal) contributed DOM matchMedia and MediaQueryList API support ([#2017](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2017)) addressing long-standing feature request [#608](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/608)
- [Ty Overby](https://github.com/TyOverby) reported Safari WebAssembly validation issues ([#1975](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1975)) helping identify browser compatibility problems

summaries.brief_summary: Compiler performance improvements through inlining pass rewrite, deadcode optimization fixes, and UTF-8 encoding bug fixes
summaries.new_features_summary: Rewritten inlining pass for better performance, functor inlining optimization, deadcode elimination improvements, and UTF-8 encoding fix
summaries.new_features:
- **Inlining pass rewrite** delivering substantial performance improvements with 50-80% reduction in benchmark times for Bonsai applications and minimal binary size impact ([#1935](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1935))
- **Functor inlining optimization** restricting aggressive inlining to O3 optimization level only for JavaScript code generation ([3695d26](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/3695d266145904db482567d44bbcc8bbed231fbf))
- **Deadcode elimination** fix preventing premature optimization that was breaking tailcall preservation ([#2010](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2010))
- **UTF-8 encoding bug fix** in `caml_utf8_of_utf16` function correcting high surrogate handling for proper Unicode conversion ([#2008](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2008))
- **Build system update** to Dune 3.19 with configuration changes across multiple opam files ([#1957](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1957))
- **Timing improvements** in wasmoo compiler with enhanced profiling capabilities ([69ed235](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/69ed23501713f853fb7362c4a936873d73971f34))
summaries.activity_summary: Multiple compiler optimization merges, ongoing lambda lifting experimentation, and active code review discussions
summaries.activity:
- **New PRs opened** including prototype system work and performance investigations ([#1886](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1886) lambda lifting experimentation by [Olivier Nicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole))
- **Compiler optimization merges** completed with [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) delivering multiple performance improvements including driver refactoring ([#2012](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2012)), effects debugging adjustments ([#2011](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2011)), and timing enhancements ([#2005](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2005))
- **Inlining pass rewrite** by [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) achieved production readiness with extensive testing by [Ricky Vetter](https://github.com/rickyvetter) and [Ty Overby](https://github.com/TyOverby) confirming performance gains ([#1935](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1935))
- **Arity propagation** feature merged by [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) improving function optimization across compilation units ([#1594](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1594))
- **Build system modernization** completed with Dune 3.19 adoption and cleanup of deadcode in compiler modules ([#1957](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1957), [#2015](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2015))
summaries.trends_summary: Continued focus on performance optimization and compiler robustness with active community testing
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Performance-driven development** with substantial runtime improvements through compiler optimizations and extensive internal testing by industrial users
- **Compiler robustness** improvements addressing edge cases in deadcode elimination and effects handling through systematic bug fixes
- **Build system modernization** with updated toolchain dependencies and cleanup of legacy code patterns
summaries.contributors_summary: Active development by core maintainers with external testing and feedback from industry users
summaries.contributors:
- [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) delivered multiple compiler improvements including UTF-8 encoding fixes ([#2008](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2008)), deadcode optimization fixes ([#2010](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2010)), driver refactoring ([#2012](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2012)), and build system updates ([#1957](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1957))
- [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) completed the inlining pass rewrite delivering substantial performance improvements for JavaScript generation ([#1935](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1935))
- [Olivier Nicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole) provided technical reviews and continued lambda lifting experimentation with performance analysis ([#1886](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1886))
- [Bao Zhiyuan](https://github.com/bzy-debug) reported and helped fix UTF-8 encoding bug with detailed analysis and test cases ([#2006](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2006))
- [Bikal Lem](https://github.com/bikallem) reported event handler execution issues in WASM mode affecting ocaml-vdom integration ([#1948](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1948))
- [Ricky Vetter](https://github.com/rickyvetter) and [Ty Overby](https://github.com/TyOverby) provided extensive testing and performance validation of optimization work including Bonsai benchmark results

summaries.brief_summary: Major week of performance optimizations and WASM binary output improvements
summaries.new_features_summary: WASM binary output for faster generation, bigarray hashing fix, and JS strings compatibility improvements
summaries.new_features:
- **WASM binary output** support for faster compilation and processing ([#2000](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2000), [#2003](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2003)) - compiler now outputs binary WASM modules instead of text files when possible, significantly improving binaryen performance
- **Bigarray hashing consistency** fix ensuring consistent hash values across all architectures ([#1977](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1977))
- **JS strings compatibility** fix for toplevel when use-js-strings is disabled ([#1997](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1997))
- **Profile handling refactor** with new Profile module ([#1993](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1993)) modernizing optimization profile management
- **Debug variable naming** option `--debug var` for unique variable names in pretty mode ([#1986](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1986))
- **Werror support** enabling warnings-as-errors for the codebase ([#1999](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1999))
summaries.activity_summary: Intensive optimization work with 21 PRs merged focusing on compilation speed and code generation efficiency
summaries.activity:
- **Compilation speed improvements** delivered through multiple optimization passes including faster constant sharing ([#1988](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1988)), enhanced JS variable assignment logic ([#1986](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1986)), and faster free variable analysis ([#1989](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1989))
- **WASM processing acceleration** through binary output support ([#2000](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2000)) and optimized WAT generation ([#1992](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1992)) by [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) and [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo)
- **Optimization pass reordering** work ([#2001](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2001)) improving compiler convergence and related experimental passes ([#1998](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1998), [#1996](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1996), [#1995](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1995)) exploring deadcode and phi optimizations
- **Code quality enhancements** including deprecation of polymorphic comparisons ([#1981](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1981)), deadcode elimination improvements ([#1978](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1978)), and queue access optimizations ([#1985](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1985))
- **WASM runtime improvements** with DataView primitives for bigarrays ([#1979](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1979)) and JavaString hash function relocation ([#1990](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1990)) for Firefox compatibility
- **Testing and benchmark adjustments** including microbenchmark improvements ([#1973](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1973)) and performance testing infrastructure

summaries.brief_summary: Major compiler optimization improvements with enhanced deadcode elimination, faster coloring, and improved optimization pass scheduling
summaries.new_features_summary: Improved optimization pass scheduling, enhanced deadcode elimination, faster coloring algorithm, and more efficient bytecode parsing
summaries.new_features:
- **Improved optimization pass scheduling** that speeds up compilation by stopping sooner when optimizations become unproductive and better coordinating multiple optimization rounds ([#1962](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1962))
- **Enhanced deadcode elimination** with block merging optimization that can merge thousands of unnecessary blocks for better control flow ([#1967](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1967), [#1963](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1963))
- **Speedup coloring algorithm** by removing bottlenecks that significantly improve compilation performance ([#1971](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1971))
- **More efficient bytecode parsing** that generates fewer block parameters, reducing memory usage and improving compilation speed ([#1972](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1972))
- **Compact program address representation** reducing memory consumption by 3-5% on large programs through sparse block address optimization ([#1968](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1968))
- **Enhanced constant evaluation** with improved comparison functions for better JavaScript primitive specialization ([#1965](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1965))
- **Debug statistics improvements** for optimization passes with better tracking and validation of compiler optimizations ([#1959](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1959))
- **Fixed examples compilation** by updating dune workspace configuration ([#1974](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1974))
summaries.activity_summary: Extensive compiler optimization work dominated the week with multiple performance improvements and one ongoing WebAssembly feature request
summaries.activity:
- **New feature request opened** by [Olivier Nicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole) for passing flags to Binaryen to enable multimemory support for linking with Emscripten modules ([#1956](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1956))
- **Comprehensive compiler optimization effort** led by [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) and [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) with 12 merged PRs implementing major performance improvements across deadcode elimination, optimization scheduling, coloring algorithms, and bytecode parsing
- **WebAssembly bug fixes** including Safari 18.4 validation issues reported by [Ty Overby](https://github.com/TyOverby) ([#1975](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1975)) and integer conversion problems ([#1955](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1955))
- **JavaScript effects integration** improvements with bug fix for Js_error handling when effects are enabled ([#1970](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1970))
- **Development infrastructure** enhancements including benchmark adjustments for better measurement accuracy ([#1973](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1973)) and GitHub issue template improvements

summaries.new_features_summary: Wasm runtime type renaming from $string to $bytes, compilation process improvements, and runtime optimizations
summaries.new_features:
- **Wasm runtime type system** updated with `$string` renamed to `$bytes` for better clarity ([2b42149](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/2b421491629ebad4e43c006ca0f5dd8f7c15895d))
- **Wasm compilation process** improvements including better runtime linking and optimization handling ([937e849](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/937e84920335b58a5598f222a613f62f781912f7))
- **Runtime cleanup** across multiple WASM modules with consistent naming conventions for string/bytes operations ([6d6fc9d](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/6d6fc9d2666875bc098b4a8b19953b0afa070fde))
- **Wasm runtime** function updates including `caml_extract_string` renamed to `caml_extract_bytes` and improved Safari compatibility ([9f19bc3](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/9f19bc307df2a6200f9cbc600b4d1fd3da4ba3d0))
summaries.activity_summary: Two bug reports filed covering reactive table headers and WASM effect handler runtime errors
summaries.activity:
- **Reactive table headers bug** reported by [Ali El-Madani](https://github.com/Ali-7CC) affecting js_of_ocaml 5.8.2 where table headers randomly stop updating when inspected in dev tools ([#1837](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1837))
- **WASM effect handler runtime error** reported by [Satoru Kawahara](https://github.com/Nymphium) where illegal cast exceptions occur instead of expected uncaught effect exceptions in wasm_of_ocaml 6.0.1 ([#1839](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1839))
summaries.discussions_summary: Technical discussion about WASM effect handlers requiring Node.js 23 with JSPI experimental flag or CPS transformation
summaries.notable_discussions: - **WASM effect handlers compatibility** discussion where [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) provided solutions for JSPI API support, recommending Node.js 23 with `--experimental-wasm-jspi` flag or using CPS transformation with `--effects=cps` flag ([#1839](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1839))
summaries.trends_summary: Focus on WASM backend improvements with systematic runtime cleanup and type system refinements
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **WASM backend maturation** with comprehensive runtime cleanup affecting 41 files and 880+ line changes across the entire WASM runtime system
- **Type system consistency** improvements in WASM runtime with better naming conventions between string and bytes operations
- **Compilation process optimization** with enhanced linking and runtime handling capabilities for WASM targets
summaries.contributors_summary: Three contributors active with bug reporting and technical support for WASM-related issues
summaries.contributors:
- [Ali El-Madani](https://github.com/Ali-7CC) reported detailed bug with reactive table headers including reproducible code example ([#1837](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1837))
- [Satoru Kawahara](https://github.com/Nymphium) reported WASM effect handler runtime errors with minimal reproduction case ([#1839](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1839))
- [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) provided technical support and solutions for WASM effect handler compatibility issues ([#1839](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1839))
